VectorGuard-Nano: Messaging Security for AI Agents

Simple HMAC-based obfuscation for AI agent messaging. Open-source under Apache 2.0 (free for non-commercial use).

⚠️ Clear positioning: VectorGuard-Nano is lightweight message obfuscation, NOT enterprise-grade encryption. For production security with model-derived cryptography, see VectorGuard Enterprise.

What It Does

Deterministic string obfuscation using:

  • HMAC-SHA256 for shift pattern generation
  • Shared secrets between agents
  • Timestamp/nonce binding
  • Reversible character shifting

Quick Start

import { secureSend, secureReceive } from './Vgn.js';

// Agent A sends
const payload = secureSend("Deploy model v2", "shared-secret", "agent-ops");

// Agent B receives  
const original = secureReceive(
  payload.encoded,
  "shared-secret", 
  "agent-ops",
  payload.timestamp
);

Message Size Limits

Recommended: < 1KB per message
Maximum: ~4KB (technical limit)

Good For

  • Agent chat on Moltbook, Discord, Telegram
  • Obfuscating commands in public logs
  • Prototype/demo applications
  • Learning agent security concepts

Not For

  • Financial transactions
  • Healthcare data (HIPAA)
  • Mission-critical production systems
  • Replacing TLS/HTTPS

Get Started
